sub_title: PhD candidate specialized in computer vision * medical image processing * deep learning * machine learning * signal processing * data science * biomedical sciences * radiation therapy
summary:
I am a computer vision scientist, data scientist, and biomedical scientist with specialties in medical image processing, signal processing, deep learning, and machine learning, and radiation therapy. I have a strong passion for proactively pushing on the development and deployment of cutting-edge computer vision, signal processing, machine learning, and deep learning techniques in the medical and industrial fields for the benefit of patients and customers. I distinguish myself through my application- and results-oriented attitudes by providing efficient and high-performance algorithms, participating deeply in the clinical routines, and collaborating closely with doctors and technicians. I have international study and work experience in five countries on three different continents, being involved in four universities, which gives me an international vision and the ability to work in a multi-culturally diverse environment. 

As a research associate in the medical imaging research center of KU Leuven, I put a lot of effort into developing AI-based computer vision platform to assist doctors in the planning and verification of liver cancer treatment by using cutting-edge deep learning and machine learning techniques. This platform was applied to over 100 patients in 3 years. I was closely involved in the clinical routine and the processing of patient data at University Hospitals Leuven. I also collaborated with medical imaging companies in UK and Belgium for optimizing medical image software and clinical workflows. I recognize myself as a technology innovator in the team, bringing new ideas to the current system, taking firm actions to achieve the goals, and making concrete and effective changes.  The successful application of my research results and algorithms to the clinic gave me a strong feeling of self-fulfillment and a desire to contribute more to the industrial and medical worlds. 

My Ph.D. research, funded by the EU’s H2020 programme, gave me plentiful opportunities to network with other excellent researchers and professors in medical imaging across the world. During the last four years, I visited different institutions, universities, and companies in the United Kingdom, France, Austria, and Belgium. This gave me a broad international vision and interest in diverse cultures. Regular secondments to the medical imaging company in UK during my Ph.D. and internship at Philips during my master enabled me to know how R&D is conducted in the industry. This gave me a different perspective from industry instead of a single thinking pattern in academia.

projects.title: Healthcare Yearns for Bright Researchers for Imaging Data (HYBRID) - the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement No 764458）
projects.description: Goal: Brings together international academic, industrial and non-governmental organizations (NGO) partners in a cross-specialty platform to advance imaging sciences as part of personalized medicine with a focus on molecular and hybrid, anato-metabolic imaging.

contributors.headline: PhD candidate specialized in computer vision * medical image processing * deep learning * machine learning * signal processing * data science * biomedical sciences * radiation therapy

projects.title: Next Generation X-ray Imaging System (NEXIS) - the European Union's Horizon 2020 programme (Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement No 780026)
projects.description:
A photonics driven breakthrough in image quality and functionality of an interventional X-ray system will allow to perform stroke diagnosis directly in the treatment suite and have a huge impact: enhanced work flow, reduced diagnosis & treatment time (up to 50% time reduction) which will save people’s life and reduce healthcare costs.
NEXIS will establish enhanced contrast Cone Beam CT imaging while keeping high spatial resolution for 2D image guidance by an innovative spectral X-ray detector and related advanced image processing (including deep learning). New key photonic components will be developed to realize a novel detector showing high-end performance for both spectral and non-spectral X-ray imaging. The usability and applicability of the new spectral NEXIS X-ray system for stroke imaging will be clinically evaluated in a European top hospital.
The project brings together a multidisciplinary consortium, involving the full value chain (photonics R&D, medical system integrator, application owner, supply chain and equipment manufacturing). It will allow key players in the European medical photonics industry to generate sales and stay competitive by providing new X-ray imaging modalities and EU based manufacturing. NEXIS will strengthen European competitiveness by developing a spectral detector technology that meets the needs of the European and global X-ray image detectors market. In the coming decade NEXIS is expected to initiate the transition of standard (black&white) to spectral (colour) X-ray detectors, which will improve performance and functionality of X-ray imaging systems.

authors.headline: PhD candidate specialized in computer vision * medical image processing * deep learning * machine learning * signal processing * data science * biomedical sciences * radiation therapy

profile_positions.description:
AI-based computer vision platform development for image-guided therapy,
facilitating the standardization, precision, and automation of treatment for liver cancer
Programming: python, c++, TensorFlow, Keras, IDL
•	AI system for tumor detection and automatic liver and tumor contouring for CT and MR, applied to over 100 patients.
•	AI-guided image registration algorithm by numerical optimization, comparable performance with commercial tools.
•	In-depth design, implementation, and optimization of deep learning algorithms tailored to clinical use.
•	Substantial performance boosting of deep learning models for real-world clinical images.
•	Assembled AI platform integrated into the commercial software, used in the clinical routines of the hospital for 3 years.
•	Successful standardization and automation of clinical workflows using the AI platform, applied to tens of patients. 
•	Substantial reduction of the clinical manual workload, like manual delineation of the liver and tumors
•	Initiative collaboration with medical software companies and medical doctors for developing clinical tools.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description:
Machine learning system for segmentation and classification of materials for CBCT with dual-layer detector
•	Algorithm development for edge extraction of CBCTs, using the edge detector, interest point detection, and unsupervised learning (clustering).
•	Material separation using edges and dual-energy information of CBCTs.
•	3D mesh simulation of vessels using computer graphics programs. 
•	Collaboration with scientists and engineers in Philips Healthcare for algorithm development.
profile_positions.title: Research Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Improving 3D Ultrasound Needle Localization in noisy detection using machine learning method, Conditional Random Fields (CRF)
•	3D CRF programming in c++ based on 2D CRF in 1 month through self-study.
•	Needle localization improvement from noisy detection in 3D ultrasound volumes using 3D CRF.
profile_positions.title: Student Researcher
